DESCRIPTION.value: Enterprise reference model for travel and cruise integration, emphasizing reservation, sales channels, partner interfaces, and the integration layer used to reduce point-to-point connections. Functional flows: 1) Customer reservation: Guests -> B2C -> Reservation -> Inventory/Pricing -> Payments -> Reservation -> Notifications. 2) Agent booking: Travel Agents -> B2B -> Reservation -> Inventory/Pricing -> Payments -> Reservation. 3) OTA booking: OTAs -> Channel Manager -> Reservation -> Booking updates -> Channel Manager -> OTAs. 4) Disruption handling: Reservation updates -> Operations -> Notifications. 5) Finance posting: Reservation/Payments -> Finance -> Data Platform.

Disclaimer.value: AI-generated reference model. Validate against organization policies, vendor capabilities, and regulatory requirements before use.

Engagement Focus.value: Integration layer definition, partner-facing interface scope, interface catalogue/backlog, and early ADRs/NFRs for travel reservation and sales channels.

systems.Description: System of record for bookings, pricing commitments, availability, and passenger itineraries.
systems.Key Capabilities: Booking lifecycle; Itinerary management; Fare rules; Inventory control; PNR management
systems.Issues/Challenges: Legacy integrations and limited real-time partner visibility
systems.Future Improvements/Plans: Expose canonical APIs and event streams for booking lifecycle
